results.title: This'll do me
results.brief_description: Scenes showing the manufacture and use of fibrous plaster products are used to illustrate the various opportunities for employment in the fibrous plaster industry. Shows the manufacture of plaster sheet and cornice moulds and also the making by hand of moulds for commemorative plaques, complicated patterns used in interior design, window display modellings and other materials requiring the work of skilled artists.
results.description: Scenes showing the manufacture and use of fibrous plaster products are used to illustrate the various opportunities for employment in the fibrous plaster industry. results.title: Thirsty land
results.creator_credit: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan and World Food Program
results.brief_description: Describes the search for water in the deserts of Jordan, and other UN assisted works - the training of the Bedouin in farming techniques, the reclamation of land, irrigation, improvement of communications and reafforestation.

results.title: They can do it
results.creator_credit: Lore Rasmussen, Allan Leitman and Education Development Centre
results.brief_description: Traces the development of an infant teacher’s approach to a class over a period of eight months at Pastorious Public School, Philadelphia. Initial traditional methods gain little response from her negro and underprivileged students. On introduction of a more relaxed and individual teaching program, the children become more involved with their surroundings and teacher.

results.title: Thermionic valve
results.brief_description: The thermionic valve makes possible the control of energy that is released when electricity is liberated from a metal. The thermionic valve is the radio valve - the forerunner to mini valves, thence the transistor.
results.description: The thermionic valve makes possible the control of energy that is released when electricity is liberated from a metal. The thermionic valve is the radio valve - the forerunner to mini valves, thence the transistor.

results.title: There once lived a dog
results.creator_credit: E. Nazarov and Soviet Film Studios Moscow
results.brief_description: A delightful Ukrainian folk tale about a pet dog who becomes a nuisance and is dumped in the local woods. The dog, with the help of a wolf, plans a way to be reaccepted by his owners.

results.title: Theory of management development
results.brief_description: Dr. Charles Ferguson presents a lecture about the nature of a manager, discussing some of the assumptions upon which management development theory is based, and the importance of a manager’s self knowledge and awareness of the multiple roles he or she performs as a supervisor, a peer, and a subordinate.

results.title: Then and Now
results.brief_description: Recounts the story of the Gaganja tribe and of an Aboriginal elder’s experience of white people entering his land.It compares the early conflict of settlement with the situation in Australia today. Winner of the category “Create a moving image stamp story” An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
